dash.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to go or run somewhere very quickly
dash.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Olive dashed into the room, grabbed her bag, and ran out again.
dash.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to throw or push something violently against something, especially so that it breaks
dash.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The ship was dashed against the rocks.
Waves were dashing against the sea wall.
dash.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a small amount of a substance that is added to something else
dash.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Add salt, pepper and a dash of vinegar.
dash.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a small amount of a quality that is added to something else
dash.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Add a dash of romance to your life with a trip to Paris.
dash.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: an occasion when someone runs somewhere very quickly in order to get away from something or someone, or in order to reach them
dash.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: When the alarm went there was a mad dash for the exit.
He made a dash for the door.
The prisoners made a dash for freedom.
It’s pouring with rain – we’ll have to make a dash for it.
dash.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: a line ( – ) used in writing to separate two closely related parts of a sentence, as for example, in the sentence ‘Go home – they’re waiting for you.’
dash.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: a long sound or flash of light used for sending messages in Morse code
dash.translation[1].definitions[6].defin: style, energy, and courage in someone such as a soldier
dash.translation[1].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 2: an occasion when someone runs somewhere very quickly in order to get away from something or someone, or in order to reach them
dash.translation[1].note_box[0].sections: The rain had almost stopped so we decided to make a dash for home.
He turned and made a dash for it but the police officer caught him.
Have I got time to make a quick dash to the shops?
He made a sudden dash for the door.
‘Something’s burning’, she said, making a mad dash for the kitchen.
I made a headlong dash up the street but just missed the bus.
We only just caught our plane, after a last-minute dash to the airport.
